subject: RE: [junit] Junit and mock objects
msgSnippet: Thanks for your suggestions. Unless I m doing something wrong, your suggestion does not work. I add the method to the interface and when I try to implement it
messageBody:
Thanks for your suggestions.



Unless I'm doing something wrong, your suggestion does not work.

I add the method to the interface and when I try to implement it as a
static method I get this error:

myMethod() in NetworkIntImp cannot implement myMethod() in NetworkInt;
overriding method is static



Regards

Pico



________________________________

From: Andrew McDonagh [mailto:andrew.mcdonagh@...]
Sent: 21 February 2005 06:12 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Junit and mock objects



Pico Geyer wrote:

>Thanks Andrew.
>
>










No problem.

>
>
>The example you provided was a great help.
>
>I have another related question though:
>
>If the class that your are creating a wrapper for (in our example
NetworkInterface) has static methods, your forced to leave these static
methods out of the interface because you can't declare a static method
in a interface. This would mean that these methods can't be included in
your mock object.
>
>
>

Basically you'll need to do as Chris suggests.
